intro: Semecarpus rufovelutinus, commonly known as the red velvet sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey-brown bark and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing single seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The species is notable for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Ayurvedic medicine.
